III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or around 1/15/25, a staff member slapped a youth on the left
side of the face for unknown reasons. The staff member was
moved to another unit 1/19/25, but did have access to the youth
until that time.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
21, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported
she was working on Wednesday, January 15, 2025, in a unit
where Youth A does not reside. She reported around 7:45pm, she
walked into Youth A’s unit to get food out of the fridge and saw
Youth A becoming agitated, while the other youth were getting
ready for bed. A little bit later, Staff 2 could hear noises coming
from the cafeteria and assumed it was Youth A. She reported
Youth A likes to strip off her clothes and defecate when she is in a
negative mood. Staff 2 reported that staff are trained to bring
Youth A into the cafeteria to give her space away from other youth
and to calm down with staff supervision. She reported she peaked
into the cafeteria from the door and saw Staff 1 sitting on the table
with her back towards her and Youth A sitting on the ground. Staff
2 reported she did not have a great view of the situation. She
reported seeing Staff 1 get off the table and made contact with
Youth A but was unable to provide further information on this
contact. Staff 2 believes she saw Youth A’s head go back but
could not confirm exactly what she saw since she only peaked in
for less than a minute. She reported that she heard Youth A cry in
the cafeteria and that Youth A was in the cafeteria for less than an
hour. Staff 2 reported when she came into work on Saturday,
January 18, 2025, Youth A wanted to talk to her about her neck
hurting. She reported Youth A told her on Wednesday, Staff 1 had
pulled her hair and slapped her face. Staff 2 reported she reported
these concerns to Administrator 2. She reported she has worked
with Staff 1 for quite some time and denied having any concerns
about her ability to provide care, nor any concerns of physical
abuse with children. Staff 2 reported Youth A is typically well-
2

behaved with Staff 1 and is typically Youth A's go-to staff to help
calm down. She reported staff are not allowed to physically harm
a youth. She reported staff are to follow the youth’s calming plan
which all staff are trained on.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth
A reported that some days she has behaviors and staff have to
deal with her. When asked to explain more, she reported she
would strip off her clothes and then defecate on the floor. Youth A
reported this occurred last Wednesday because she was mad at
Staff 1. She reported Staff 1 escorted her into the cafeteria to calm
down. Youth A reported while in the cafeteria, Staff 1 pulled her
hair and slapped her on the face. She reported there was no one
else in the cafeteria with them but did witness Staff 2 look into the
cafeteria for a short moment. Youth A went on to explain she was
jumping on all the tables in the cafeteria, falling off them, and then
would start to cry. She reported that she stopped jumping, then
Staff 1 pulled her hair and slapped her with an open palm to the
face. Youth A reported she then physically attacked Staff 1 and
broke Staff 1’s glasses. She complained of her neck hurting but
could not explain how she hurt it. Youth A did disclose that she
was banging her head on “everything” in the cafeteria because
she was upset. She could not provide a timeline of how long she
was in the cafeteria on Wednesday, January 15, 2025. Youth A
reported that she was in the cafeteria for over 24 hours and the
next day Staff 1 assaulted her all over again. She continued to
state throughout the interview that Staff 1 needs to get fired. Youth
A reported she told Foster Care Worker about this assault. She
reported she did see the nurse about her neck pain and was
provided medication. There were no visible injuries observed on
Youth A's face or neck by this consultant and MDHHS Worker.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Law
Enforcement. Staff 1 reported she has been working at the facility
for about 2.5 years. She reported on January 15, 2025, there was
a new youth admitted to the unit that was struggling at bedtime
which increased Youth A’s behaviors. Staff 1 reported Youth A
began to attempt to strip off her clothes and be physically
aggressive. She reported to help Youth A calm down, it was
decided amongst the team to escort Youth A into the cafeteria to
have a calm place away from the unit. Staff 1 reported Youth A
ended up kicking Staff 3 in the face and knocked Staff 1’s glasses
off her face. Staff 4 came over to the unit to help and escorted
Youth A with Staff 1 to the cafeteria. Once they were in the
3

cafeteria, Youth A remained sitting on the floor closest to the west
door and the kitchen door entrance, while Staff 1 sat on the table
closest to the west door with her feet on the chair. Staff 1
explained Youth A was throwing herself around on the ground,
making suicidal statements, and attempting to headbang. While
Youth A was sitting on the floor, she started to pee on the ground,
and Staff 1 leaned over to move Youth A’s clothes that were
stripped off, so they did not get dirty. Staff 1 denied ever being a
threat to Youth A or ever putting her hands near Youth A when in
the cafeteria. She denied ever slapping her or pulling her hair.
Staff 1 reported she was in the cafeteria for about half an hour in
total with Youth A. She reported when Youth A calmed down on
her own, she asked for her medications, got dressed cleaned up
the cafeteria, and went to bed. When asked if anyone else was in
the cafeteria with them, Staff 1 reported Staff 3 was in there for
some time and some staff would peek into the room to check in on
them. She again denied at any point pully Youth A’s hair or hitting
Youth A anywhere on her body. Staff 1 reported she has a good
relationship with Youth A and was very confused about why these
allegations came to be. She explained she can usually speak with
Youth A to help de-escalate her faster than some other staff due
to having a positive relationship. Staff 1 was knowledgeable of
Youth A’s calming plan and was able to follow it in this situation.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Law
Enforcement. Staff 3 reported when she was in the staff office on
January 15, 2025, she heard Youth A becoming verbally
escalated near bedtime. She reported when she was on the unit,
she heard Youth A state Staff 1 had pulled her hair. Staff 3
reported Youth A was sitting in a chair during this time and Staff 1
was sitting against the wall talking with another youth. Youth A
then began becoming more physically aggressive and started to
attempt to take off her clothes. She reported she attempted to
escort Youth A with Staff 1 to the cafeteria, but Youth A had
kicked Staff 3 in the face. Staff 3 reported she went to take care of
her injury when Staff 4 stepped in for support. She reported after a
few minutes went by, she went to check in on Youth A and Staff 1
in the cafeteria. When she walked in, she saw Staff 1 sitting at the
table closest to the door and Youth A sitting on a chair near her.
She reported she heard Youth A crying and apologizing to Staff 1
for her behavior and heard Staff 1 giving Youth A verbal directions
on the next steps. Staff 3 denied observing Staff 1 become
physical with Youth A. When asked if she ever had concerns
about Staff 1’s ability to care for youth, she denied this and
mentioned she looked up to Staff 1 as a mentor. She reported
4

Staff 1 is great with the youth and is the main staff Youth A listens
to. Staff 3 reported Youth A has a history of being dishonest about
things and will often talk poorly about staff when upset with them.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Law
Enforcement. Staff 4 reported on January 15, 2025, he walked
over to assisted Staff 1 with Youth A. He reported Youth A was
escalated on the unit to where she was starting to get physically
aggressive and attempting to strip off her clothing. Staff 4 reported
Youth A had kicked Staff 3 in the face and had pulled off Staff 1’s
glasses. He reported he assisted with Staff 1 to escort Youth A to
the cafeteria to give her some space to calm down. Staff 4
reported in the escort they helped guide Youth A into the cafeteria
where she took some space to calm down. He reported Staff 1
stayed in the cafeteria with Youth A while he went to check in on
Staff 3. Staff 4 reported during the time he was with Staff 1 and
Youth A he did not witness Youth A get assaulted. He reported he
has never witnessed any concerns of Staff 1 hurting youth at the
facility or being inappropriate with them. Staff 4 reported for the
events he was involved in, all staff followed proper protocol and
policies.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
Law Enforcement. Supervisor reported on Thursday January 16,
2025, she supervised a phone call with Youth A and her Adoption
worker. During that phone call, Youth A reported a staff member
had pulled her hair the other day, but did not name the staff’s
name. She then reported that she was in the cafeteria by herself
when it happened, and it may have been herself who pulled her
hair. Supervisor reported Youth A continued to change the story
throughout the phone call. She reported she has witnessed Staff 1
interact with Youth A and it has been nothing but positive.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
21, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Nurse reported
she meets with Youth A multiple times a day as Youth A likes to
meet with the nurses at the facility. She reported she met with
Youth A earlier today and she had no complaints of neck pain.
Nurse reported on January 17, 2024, she met with Youth A
because she complained of neck pain and there were no marks
on her neck. She reported Youth A did not disclose a reason why
the right side of her neck was hurting. Nurse reported she
checked over Youth A’s neck and did not see any concerns. She
provided Youth A with Tylenol. Nurse reported on January 20,
5

2024, she checked in with Youth A and she reported she no
longer has any neck pain.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
Law Enforcement. Administrator 2 reported on Saturday, January
18, 2025, he received a call from Staff 2 about the concerns Youth
A had reported. He directed Staff 2 to follow the protocol of
making a report of these concerns. He reported he has never had
any concerns with Staff 1’s ability to do her job and be appropriate
with the youth’s behavior plans. Administrator 2 reported Staff 1 is
the calm staff on the unit that will sit with Youth A until she calls
down and follows her calming plan as it should be done.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately was
interviewed face to face at the facility on January 21, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B and Youth C
reported they feel safe at the facility and staff are kind to them.
They reported they had never seen or heard about a staff slapping
a youth. Youth B reported staff use verbal de-escalation to help
calm down youth and only go hands-on with a youth when they
are a danger to themselves or others. Both youths reported some
youth go to the cafeteria to help calm down so that they are away
from the other youth and have one-to-one support with staff.
Youth B and Youth C reported Staff 1 has worked with them
multiple times and they have no concerns about her.
Law Enforcement was interviewed face to face at the facility
on January 27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Law Enforcement reported based on the interviews she does not
plan to move forward with any criminal charges.
Documents Reviewed:
- Email from Foster Care Worker dated January 22, 2025-
Foster Care Worker reported the only concern Youth A has
expressed to her is about the concerns of another youth at
school “bullying” her. She denied Youth A ever talking to
her about concerns of being physically assaulted by staff.
- Facility incident report dated January 15, 2025,
completed by Staff 3- Staff 2 and Staff 4 escorted Youth A
at 8:21pm into the cafeteria. Youth A had stripped her
clothing and urinated on the cafeteria floor. She began
clawing her face, stabbing her eyes, banging her head,
scratching her belly, and pulling her own hair. Staff verbally
re-dried Youth A and did some ignoring of her negative
6

behavior. Youth A was able to calm down, take her
medication, and get dressed. Youth A back in bed by
8:57pm.
- Facility Discipline Policy - Facility prohibits all cruel and
severe discipline including any type of corporal punishment
inflicted in any manner.
- Facility Behavior Management Policy- Positive
interventions strategies should be used by staff to help
assist the youth develop improved problem solving, self-
management, and social skills. Staff should utilize the
youth’s individual calming plans.
- Youth A’s Calming Plan- When Youth A is in crisis staff
are to create private space away from peers and allow her
space to calm down. Youth A has a history of disrobing and
verbal aggression.
- Facility Restraint Policy- Physical Management may only
occur with a youth whose behavior is significantly
dangerous to self or others. Physical Management is
performed according to the current techniques of the
“Handle with Care”, DART’s approved crisis intervention
program. The use of force and duration of restraint must be
limited to that which is necessary to ensure the optimal
care, welfare, safety, and security of all. Restraint
techniques must never be used for punishment, discipline,
or retaliation. Prohibited Behavior Management Techniques
at the facility includes corporal or physical punishment
including spanking, hitting, pinching, slapping, or hair
pulling.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- There are no disciplinary
actions noted within Staff 1’s file for improper care of a
youth at the facility. There was one disciplinary action noted
within Staff 1’s file due to attendance concerns. Training
records were viewed and noted Staff 1 completed her most
recent behavior management/ restraint training on
12/09/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation as Staff 1, Staff 3, and Staff
4 denied Staff 1 ever physically assaulting Youth A, and Youth A
reporting Staff 1 did physically assault her. Staff 2 was unaware of
what she saw exactly what she saw in the cafeteria with Staff 1
and Youth A. There were no videos and no marks on Youth A
following the incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
